{{BLP sources|date=August 2011}} {{EngvarB|date=June 2017}} {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2017}} {{Use British English|date=March 2018}} {{Infobox writer | name = William Breeze | pseudonym = Hymenaeus Beta | image = | image_size = | caption = | birth_name = William Gary Keith Breeze<ref name="“Companies House">{{cite news |title=Ordo Templi Prientis: company profile |url=https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/officers/YUApM1J2K5qOV_0lu34BluJHolA/appointments |accessdate=12 March 2018 |date=12 March 2018}}</ref> | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1955|08|12}} | birth_place = Paris, France | death_date = | death_place = | education = | alma_mater = [[Harvard University]], Boston | occupation = Author, voilist, international leader of [[Ordo Templi Orientis|OTO]] | nationality = American | citizenship = United States | residence = New York, United States | period = 1975–present | genre = [[Occult]] studies | subject = Biography, [[Magick (Thelema)|magick]], [[philosophy]], [[religion]] | spouse = | movement = | notableworks = ''[[The Law is for All]]'' (1996, Thelema Media) | signature = | website = }}
'''William Breeze''' (born August 12, 1955) is an American author and publisher on [[Magick (Thelema)|magick]] and philosophy. He is the current international leader of [[Ordo Templi Orientis]].<ref>{{Cite news| issn = 0261-3077| last = Flood| first = Alison| title = Unseen Aleister Crowley writings reveal 'short-story writer of the highest order'| work = The Guardian| accessdate = 2017-11-09| date = 2015-10-15|url=https://www.theguardian.com/books/2015/oct/15/unseen-aleister-crowley-writings-short-story-the-drug}}</ref> Under the name '''Hymenaeus Beta''' he is a leading editor of the occult works of English author [[Aleister Crowley]], the founder of the philosophy and religion of [[Thelema]].<ref name="“Works researched via Hymenaeus Beta">{{Cite news| title = Bibliography of Works Researched via Hymenaeus Beta and OTO Resources| work = Zero Equals Two| accessdate = 2017-11-09| date = 2015-02-05| url = http://zeroequalstwo.net/incomplete-bibliography-of-works-researched-via-hymenaeus-beta-and-oto-resources}}</ref>
==Early life and career==
Breeze came from a military family. Son of a [[US Army]] serviceman, he was born in Paris, [[France]], where his father, [[Colonel (United States)|colonel]] Breeze, was on a [[tour of duty]] at the time of his birth. Breeze spent his childhood accompanying his father, who had a very distinguished military career, on many [[tour of duty|tours of duty]] across the United States, staying with him at various [[US]] military bases, including [[Nellis Air Force Base]] located in close proximity to [[Groom Dry Lake Air Force Base]] in Nevada which is a highly classified remote detachment 83 miles (134 km) north-northwest of Las Vegas<ref name="“express.co.uk01">{{cite news |title=SHOCK CLAIM: Footage of ‘alien UFO being tested at Area 51 leaked’ |url=https://www.express.co.uk/news/weird/809310/Area-51-leaked-video-UFO-Nellis-Air-Base-aliens-Secureteam10 |date=30 March 2018}}</ref> closely linked to [[UFO]] phenomena,<ref name="“express.co.uk02">{{cite news |title=Huge UFO 'disappeared into wormhole' after bizarre events near top secret military base |url=https://www.express.co.uk/news/weird/809310/Area-51-leaked-video-UFO-Nellis-Air-Base-aliens-Secureteam10 |date=30 March 2018}}</ref> as well as [[Fort Bragg]] and [[Fort Meade, Maryland]]<ref name="“newsweek.com">{{cite news |title=MEET THE FORMER PENTAGON SCIENTIST WHO SAYS PSYCHICS CAN HELP AMERICAN SPIES |url=http://www.newsweek.com/2015/11/20/meet-former-pentagon-scientist-who-says-psychics-can-help-american-spies-393004.html |date=30 March 2018}}</ref> where [[Remote viewing]] [[Stargate Project|program]] took place,<ref name="“miamiherald.com">{{cite news |title=Fort Meade, Maryland, where psychics gathered to remotely spy on the U.S. Embassy in Iran during the hostage crisis. |url=http://www.miamiherald.com/news/nation-world/national/article131827589.html |date=30 March 2018}}</ref> and [[Montauk Air Force Station]] at the eastern tip of [[Long Island]], which was later associated with supposed [[time travel]] experiments<ref name="“Montauk Chronicles">{{cite news |title='Montauk Chronicles' Claims Time Travel, Mind Control, Aliens At Camp Hero |url=https://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/montauk-chronicles-time-travel-aliens_n_1543063|accessdate=30 March 2018 |date=30 March 2018}}</ref> as part of the [[Montauk Project]].<ref name="“MONTAUK TIME TRAVEL?">{{cite news |title=HAS THE GOVERNMENT ALREADY ACHIEVED TIME TRAVEL? |url=https://www.gaia.com/lp/content/has-the-government-already-achieved-time-travel|accessdate=30 March 2018 |date=30 March 2018}}</ref> Breeze was later educated at Harvard University in Boston where he studied music.<ref name="“Coil: Members">{{cite news |title=Coil: Members |url=http://www.brainwashed.com/coil/info/bill.html|accessdate=15 March 2018 |date=15 March 2018}}</ref>
In 1970s Breeze became a student of [[Marcelo Ramos Motta]], a [[Thelema|Thelemic]] writer from [[Brazil]], himself a former [[Military Academy]] student, as well as a student of [[Aleister Crowley]] and member of [[A∴A∴]].<ref>{{cite book | last = Motta | first = Marcelo | title = The Equinox, vol. V no. 4 | publisher = Thelema Publishing Co. | location = Nashville | year = 1981 }}</ref> In 1974 Breeze helped to publish [[Aleister Crowley]]'s ''Magical and Philosophical Commentaries on The Book of the Law''. Eedited by [[John Symonds]] and [[Kenneth Grant]], it was published by 93 Publishing, a company which was partially owned by Breeze. In 1979, when Breeze was 24 years old, he met [[Grady McMurtry]]. A veteran of the [[Normandy Invasion]] and the conquest of [[Nazi occupied Europe|Nazi-occupied Europe]], Major McMurtry served in both [[World War Two]] and the [[Korean Conflict]], and having trained and been initiated directly by [[Aleister Crowley]] who appointed him his "Caliph", McMurtry was serving as the head of [[Ordo Templi Orientis]], an international [[Fraternal organization|fraternal]] organization founded in the early part of the 20th century.<ref>{{cite book| last = Crowley | first = Aleister| authorlink = Aleister Crowley | editor = Hymenaeus Beta | others = Soror Meral, Research Ed.| title = The Review of Scientific Illuminism: The Official Organ of the O.T.O | edition = Revised | series = The Equinox #10 | volume = III | origyear = March 1986 |date=July 1990 | publisher = [[Weiser Books]] | location = York Beach, Maine | isbn=0-87728-719-8 | ref=Eq310 |display-authors=etal}}</ref> McMurtry granted Breeze a charter to form an [[Ordo Templi Orientis|OTO]] lodge of which Breeze later became a master. In 1985, Breeze succeeded McMurtry as Outer Head of OTO. After McMurtry's death, under Breeze's leadership, OTO began to grow internationally for the first time. Over the next decade, Breeze spent his time establishing International Headquarters and chartering new Lodges. By the end of the Twentieth Century, the organization has grown to several thousand members over time.<ref name="Hymenaeus Beta Governing Anniversary“"/>
==Governing of O.T.O.== {{Thelema}} Since 21 September 1985, Breeze served as the Head of [[Ordo Templi Orientis]].<ref name="Hymenaeus Beta Governing Anniversary“">{{cite news|title=ONE HUNDRED YEARS OF O.T.O. |url=http://zeroequalstwo.net/new-book-success-is-your-proof-celebrates-one-hundred-years-of-o-t-o-in-north-america/ |accessdate=15 March 2018 |date=15 March 2018}}</ref>
Following the death of [[Grady McMurtry]] who was heading the Order at the time, Breeze was elected as Frater Superior of Ordo Templi Orientis in a special election by all the active IX° members of OTO.<ref>{{cite web |last=Koenig |first=Peter |url=http://www.parareligion.ch/minutes/trans.htm |title=Minutes of the Special Ninth Degree Caliphate Election |work=The Ordo Templi Orientis Phenomenon |accessdate=March 10, 2012}}</ref> He assumed the name ''Hymenaeus Beta'',<ref name="Hymenaeus Beta: Election anniversary“">{{cite news|title=31st Anniversary of election of William Breeze to succeed Grady McMurtry |url=http://zeroequalstwo.net/31-anniversary-of-election-of-hymenaeus-beta-to-succeed-alpha |accessdate=13 March 2018 |date=13 March 2018}}</ref> and later in that capacity became widely acknowledged as an expert on the life and works of [[Aleister Crowley]].<ref name="“Works researched via Hymenaeus Beta"/>
[[File:Looking along Ridge above Loch Ness - geograph.org.uk - 912966.jpg|left|thumb|The ridge above [[Loch Ness]] Foyers and Boleskine walk comes down past Boleskine. Located below, [[Boleskine House]] can be seen from the forest track.]] Breeze devoted much of his time working in the preservation of the Order’s heritage materials relating to [[Boleskine House]] (manor house in the [[Scottish Highlands]] previously owned by Aleister Crowley, who bought it for the purpose of performing a magical working based on [[The Book of Abramelin]]) and OTO’s archival materials in England.<ref name="caduceus“">{{cite web |url=http://www.caduceusbooks.com/secondhandbooks-webpage/sh-crow.htm |title=Aleister Crowley: Last Days |accessdate=4 April 2018}}</ref>
Devoting much of his time in administering the Order, Breeze also devoted a lot of time to development of the corpus of Thelemic literature and preservation of OTO's archival heritage.<ref name="Hymenaeus Beta Governing Anniversary“" /> [[File:First Pentacle of Venus.gif|left|thumb|The first pentacle of Venus from a 1889 edition of The [[Key of Solomon]] first translated and edited from Ancient Manuscripts in the [[British Museum]] by [[Samuel Liddell MacGregor Mathers]], now held in O.T.O. archives]]
Breeze, furthermore, made available his own researches, undertaken for the definitive edition of Crowley’s [[The Confessions of Aleister Crowley|Confessions]] that were published in 1990,<ref name="abebooks09“">{{cite news|title=THE CONFESSIONS OF ALEISTER CROWLEY, 1990|url=https://www.abebooks.co.uk/book-search/title/the-confessions-of-aleister-crowley-an-autohagiography/author/aleister-crowley/ |accessdate=3 July 2018 |date=3 July 2018}}</ref> becoming the biography’s co-editor.<ref name="esoteric01“">{{cite news|title=The Art of the Law: Aleister Crowley’s Use of Ritual and Drama|url=http://www.esoteric.msu.edu/VolumeV/ArtofLaw.htm |accessdate=3 July 2018 |date=3 July 2018}}</ref>
In his capacity of a Head of OTO, Breeze helped many worthy investigators such as [[Lawrence Sutin]] (author of ''DO WHAT THOU WILT: A Life of Aleister Crowley'' published in 2000, {{ISBN|978-0312288976}}),<ref name="kirkusreviews“">{{cite news|title=DO WHAT THOU WILT: A Life of Aleister Crowley |url=https://www.kirkusreviews.com/book-reviews/lawrence-sutin/do-what-thou-wilt/ |accessdate=2 April 2018 |date=2 April 2018}}</ref> [[Richard Kaczynski]] (author of ''Perdurabo: Life of Aleister Crowley'' published in 2010 by [[North Atlantic Books]], {{ISBN|978-1556438998}}), [[Tobias Churton]] (author of ''Aleister Crowley: The Biography'' published by [[Watkins Books]] in 2012, {{ISBN|978-1780281346}}),<ref name="express.co.uk01“">{{cite news|title=Aleister Crowley: The Biography |url=https://www.express.co.uk/entertainment/books/272066/Aleister-Crowley-The-Biography-review |accessdate=2 April 2018 |date=2 April 2018}}</ref> and Adam Clayton (author of ''Netherwood: Last Resort of Aleister Crowley.'' published by [[Weiser Antiquarian Books]] in 2012, {{ISBN|978-0957233409}}),<ref name="caduceus“"/><ref name="Radionics“">{{cite news|title=Aleister Crowley: Gentleman of Hastings |url=http://radionicworkshop.co.uk/netherwood-by-a-gentleman-of-hastings/|accessdate=4 April 2018 |date=4 April 2018}}</ref> to study OTO, Thelema, Aleister Crowley and related topics using the materials OTO is the guardian of.<ref name="Aleister Crowley: The Biography“">{{cite news|title=Aleister Crowley: The Biography. Watkins Books. |url=http://www.watkinsmagazine.com/aleister-crowley-the-biography |accessdate=15 March 2018 |date=15 March 2018}}</ref>
Starting in 2005, Breeze begun chartering new international Grand Lodges, including those of [[Australia]] and [[U.K.|United Kingdom]] which covers England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland, plus British Crown Dependencies.<ref name="Agape Lodge Journal“">{{cite news|title=Agape Lodge journal: Vol VII, Number 3 |url=http://lib.oto-usa.org/agape/agape.7.3.pdf |accessdate=17 March 2018 |date=17 March 2018}}</ref>
On October 10, 2014, Breeze was unanimously elected de jure Outer Head of the Order by a council of Grand Masters, and on May 16, 2015, his organisation celebrated 30 years of his governing of [[Ordo Templi Orientis|OTO]].<ref name="Hymenaeus Beta Governing Anniversary“" />
===Esoteric art=== In his capacity of Frater Superior of OTO, Breeze advised several American museums and exhibitions on esoteric art.<ref name="Breeze chairs art discussion panel"/> On February 10, 2015, he chaired a panel discussion dedicated to Los Angeles artist and occultist [[Marjorie Cameron]] and her work, which was held at Los Angeles Museum of Contemporary Art.<ref name="Cameron Art Exibition“">{{cite news|title=Deitch Projects Presents the Uncensored Story of LA Artist/Occultist Marjorie Cameron. |url=https://www.observer.com/2015/10/deitch-projects-presents-the-uncensored-story-of-la-artistoccultist-marjorie-cameron |accessdate=17 March 2018 |date=17 March 2018}}</ref>
In February 2016, Breeze co-chaired “Occult and Art” panel discussion which took place at 80WSE Gallery in New York with Professor Susan L. Aberth and artist Jesse Bransford co-chairing the panel.<ref name="Breeze chairs art discussion panel">{{cite news|title="Language of the Birds: Occult and Art" Exhibition" |url=http://zeroequalstwo.net/art-workings-watch-panel-discussion-from-language-of-the-birds-occult-art |accessdate=23 April 2018 |date=23 April 2018}}</ref> The panel discussed various artists and occultists, including Aleister Crowley, whose paintings were exhibited amongst other modern and contemporary artists who have each expressed their own engagement in magical practice.<ref name="Breeze chairs “Occult and Art” discussion panel">{{cite news|title="Panel on "Language of the Birds: Occult and Art" at 80WSE Gallery, New York" |url=http://www.artforum.com/video/panel-on-language-of-the-birds-occult-and-art-at-80wse-gallery-new-york-58280 |accessdate=23 April 2018 |date=23 April 2018}}</ref>
==Works== ===As author=== Under his pseudonym, '''Hymenaeus Beta''', Breeze has written extensively on magic and Thelemic initiation in various occult periodicals, including ''The Magical Link''<ref name="The Magical Link“">{{cite news|title=The Magical Link', Vol. V, #3, 1985: The Right to Innitiation|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170325051541/https://www.thelema.ca/156/OTO/hb_freewill.html |accessdate=16 March 2018 |date=16 March 2018}}</ref> and texts entitled ''Culture Versus Cult'' contained within ''The Equinox Vol 3 No. 10'', published in 1990.<ref name="The Equinox Vol 3“">{{cite news|title=The Equinox: The Review of Scientific Illuminism Vol 3 No. 10|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111119211536/http://www.book-of-thoth.com/archives-printpage-1580.html |accessdate=12 April 2018 |date=12 April 2018}}</ref> His editorial forewords include prolegomenon to ''Liber Aleph Vel CXI: The Book of Wisdom or Folly'',<ref name="The Book of Wisdon or Folly“">{{cite news|title=The Book of Wisdom or Folly|url=https://www.weiserantiquarian.com/pages/books/59164/hymenaeus-beta-a-aleister-edited-crowley/liber-aleph-vel-cxi-the-book-of-wisdom-or-folly-in-the-form-of-an-epistle-of-666-the-great-wild-beast-to/?soldItem=true |accessdate=17 May 2018 |date=17 May 2018}}</ref> preface to ''Initiation in the Aeon of the Child: The Inward Journey'' (Nuit - the host of mankind, Had - a single person and a star, Ra Hoor Khut - a child, result of that union)<ref name="Initiation“">{{cite news|title=Initiation in the Aeon of the Child: The Inward Journey|url=https://www.amazon.co.uk/Initiation-Aeon-Child-Inward-Journey/dp/0892542098 |accessdate=12 April 2018 |date=12 April 2018}}</ref> written by J. Daniel Gunther (published in 2014, {{ISBN|978-0892542093}}), as well as editorial introduction to ''Magick: Liber ABA, Book Four'' ({{ISBN|978-0877289197}}) and introduction to Aleister Crowley's edition of ''[[The Goetia]]'', which explores the relationship between Crowley and [[Samuel Liddell MacGregor Mathers]], and the importance of the [[Lesser Key of Solomon]] in the [[grimoire]] tradition.<ref name="Goetia“">{{cite news|title=The Goetia (Edited, annotated, introduced and enlarged by Aleister Crowley, this edition edited by Hymenaeus Beta)|url=https://www.weiserantiquarian.com/pages/books/55768/s-l-macgregor-mathers-this-edition-aleister-crowley-hymenaeus-beta-annotated-edited-introduced/the-goetia-the-lesser-key-of-solomon-the-king-lemegeton-book-i-clavicula-salomonis-regis |accessdate=12 April 2018 |date=12 April 2018}}</ref>
===As editor=== Breeze is known as the editor of several of the works of Aleister Crowley. Some of the works he edited include: {{div col|colwidth=}} *''The Equinox, Volume III, Number 10'', 1990, [[Weiser Books]]. {{ISBN|978-0877287193}} *''[[The Equinox of the Gods (Crowley)|The Equinox of the Gods]]'', New Falcon Publications. *''The Heart of the Master & Other Papers'', Thelema Media. {{ISBN|978-1561840304}} *''[[The Law is for All]]'', Thelema Media. {{ISBN|978-5988821113}} *''[[Magick (Book 4)|Magick: Liber ABA: Book 4]]''. Weiser Books. {{ISBN|978-0877289197}} *''The General Principles of Astrology''. Weiser Books. {{ISBN|978-1578632886}} *''[[Diary of a Drug Fiend]]''. Red Wheel/Weiser.{{ISBN|0933429118}} *''Freedom is a Two-Edged Sword'', co-edited with [[Marjorie Cameron]], authored by [[John Whiteside Parsons|Jack Parsons]], 1989, New Falcon Publications *''Three Essays on Freedom'', authored by [[John Whiteside Parsons|Jack Parsons]], 2008, Teitan Press. {{isbn|978-0-933429-11-6}} {{div col end}}
==Musical career== As a musician, Breeze came to prominence in the late 1990s when in the early years of his musical career he worked with poet-percussionist and [[Velvet Underground]] cofounder [[Angus MacLise]]. Breeze played electric viola, mandolin, guitar, bass and electronics. Footage of Breeze performing alongside Maclise was shown at the exhibition ''Dreamweapon: The Art and Life of Angus MacLise (1938 – 1979)'' from May 10–29, 2011 curated by Johan Kugelberg and Will Swofford Cameron.<ref>{{cite web |title=Angus MacLise | DREAMWEAPON : Boo-Hooray |url=http://boo-hooray.com/dreamweapon/the-art--life-of-angus-maclise-1938-1979/ |work=boo-hooray.com |accessdate=March 10, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120323112306/http://boo-hooray.com/dreamweapon/the-art--life-of-angus-maclise-1938-1979/ |archivedate=23 March 2012 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
===Collaborations=== Breeze has played with [[Psychic TV]] and appears on the recordings ''Thee Fractured Garden'' (1995), ''[[Cold Blue Torch]]'' (1995), ''[[Trip Reset]]'' (1996) and ''Spatial Memory'' (1996) and is mostly credited as playing viola and viola synthesizer.<ref>{{Cite web |title = William Breeze Discography at Discogs |url = http://www.discogs.com/artist/William+Breeze |accessdate = 2009-08-14}}</ref>
====Coil==== Breeze has been a member of [[Coil (band)|Coil]] as an electric viola player from 1994 through 2004. Coil was a British avant garde music band founded by [[John Balance]] and [[Peter Christopherson]] whose main studio was based in [[Bristol, UK|Bristol]].<ref name="John Balance: Obituary">{{cite web|title=John Balance, joint founder of Coil, a focal point for English avant garde pop music|url=https://www.theguardian.com/news/2004/dec/11/guardianobituaries.artsobituaries|accessdate=22 April 2018}}</ref> Starting in 1994, Breeze played electric viola on many Coil’s albums, including [[The Angelic Conversation (album)|The Angelic Conversation]] and [[Time Machines]] released in 1998, and accompanied the band on various live tours, including Barcelona tour in 2000.<ref name="Rate Your Music">{{cite web|title=William Breeze at Rate Your Music|url=http://rateyourmusic.com/artist/william_breeze|publisher=Rate your Music|accessdate=24 July 2017}}</ref>
====Current 93==== After Coil’s [[John Balance#Death|dissolution]] in 2004, Breeze became a member of [[Current 93]], an experimental music group founded by [[David Tibet]].<ref name="“Current 93: Credits">{{cite news |title=Current 93: Credits |url=http://current931.bandcamp.com/album/birdsong-in-the-empire|accessdate=12 March 2018 |date=12 March 2018}}</ref>
